key_channel_insights.line_content: Last week, 95.31% of OTA prices matched Aeromexico’s website, reinforcing strong price conformity.
A majority (52.84%) of Aeromexico fares were priced lower on MSE channels, indicating significant cost competitiveness.
GDS showed consistent pricing with the website in 88% of the cases, reflecting strong price stability.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Last week, 95.31% of prices on OTA matched Aeromexico’s website, indicating strong price consistency.
OTA prices were higher than the airline’s site in 1.77% of cases last week, with minimal impact at just 0.26% above website prices.
Only 0.29% of prices were lower on OTAs last week, suggesting limited discounting by OTAs.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In 2.63% of cases, offers available on Aeromexico's website were missing on OTAs.
Consistent pricing with the airline's website was the most common status, declining slightly by 1.86% from the previous week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul had 95.22% price matches, slightly lower than long haul. OTA occasionally priced 0.26% higher last week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_title: Long Haul Stability with No Discounts
ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Long haul exhibited absolute alignment in 96.47% of OD pairs; no OTA-initiated discounts were recorded.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 95.3% of OTA prices from Mexico matched the website, with a minimal 0.28% higher pricing differential.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Non-Mexican Origins Show Limited Price Advantage
ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTAs showed 2.3% missed opportunities but offered higher prices only 2.3% of the time.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in windows, 93.52% matched, but OTAs failed to list over 3.8% of offerings.
99.22% of far-out bookings matched; occasional missed listings but rare underpricing.

mse_highlights.line_title: Dominance of Lower Pricing on MSE
mse_highlights.line_content: A significant majority of Aeromexico fares are lower on metasearch engines, making up 52.84% of the sampled itineraries over the last week.
Over the last week, 47.12% of fares are priced the same on both the Aeromexico website and MSE channels.
Only 0.04% of Aeromexico fares appeared at a higher price on MSE compared to the airline's website, indicating competitive pricing strategies.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Over half (52.84%) of offers were lower via MSE, marking a decrease from previous weeks.
47.12% of offers matched the website, showing strong alignment.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul, 49.80% of fares were lower on MSE for the latest week, which represents a slight decrease compared to previous metrics.
Long haul fares primarily maintain lower MSE pricing at 92.98%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Mexican departures demonstrate a trend where 47.40% of fares are lower on MSE, indicating a consistent competitive pricing strategy.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Strong MSE Advantage for Non-Mexican Origins
mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Non-Mexican origins predominantly show lower MSE prices at 98.08% for the last week, maintaining a lead over previous weeks.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings have 63.30% lower pricing on MSEs than the website, illustrating a strong tendency towards discounted prices in this category.
With 70% of far out bookings priced the same on MSEs as the website, there is a notable consistency across extended booking windows.

gds_highlights.line_content: The majority of Aeromexico's prices in the GDS channel remain in line with their website, with over 88% showing no discrepancy across all analyses.
Prices are higher in the GDS channel about 10% of the time for all dimensions, with slight increases noted week over week.
Instances of lower pricing in the GDS channel are rare, occurring less than 2% across most dimensions analyzed.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Most fares (88%) are the same between the GDS channel and Aeromexico's website, with minimal fluctuation over time.
Approximately 10% of price comparisons show higher fares in the GDS channel, stable with slight recent increases.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul prices in GDS remain consistent with the website 89% of the time, demonstrating stability.
Long-haul flights show more pricing variability with 19% higher fare frequencies, though mostly stable over time.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Fares originating in Mexico show strong consistency with 89% matching website fares.
Non-Mexican origin flights show more price variation, though same pricing still dominates at 78%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Prices booked close to departure are consistent with website fares 87% of the time, showing stability.
For long-term bookings, despite some variability, most fares match the website (90%).
